page.title: 12RIVER FOR WORK AND PLEASURE
page.content: Just over half a mile from Maldon Quay up river are a flour mill,timber merchants and salt works.The river is deep enough to carry grain ships.Next to the Quay is a large park known as the Prom locally(the Promenade).It be- came a favourite seaside resort in Victorian times.It has extensive play- ing fields,amusements,riverside walk, outdoor swimming pool,boating lake and stalls.In August the carnival finishes there and at the end of the evening is a spectacular firework display around and across the swimming pool.Here at Christmas time many people come to watch the Mud Races.Competitors wear fancy dress and when the tide is out they race across the river onto some mud banks and back across to the Mal- don side.It is often done in freezing temperatures.
